education_problem.title: An Education Problem
education_problem.text_1_html:
We believe everyone on this Earth has the right to a decent education...

Yet very few girls from the rural communities of the High Atlas Mountains in Morocco get the opportunity to continue their education beyond primary school.
education_problem.text_2_html:
Secondary schools, mostly several kilometres away in larger towns, are not accessible to these girls because:

  • Their parents cannot afford to pay for transport or lodgings
  • The journey to the secondary schools can be dangerous
  • Their parents do not feel safe sending their daughters away from home to the existing facilities
education_problem.text_3_html:
This means that in these rural areas up to 83% of women are illiterate. So instead of these girls following their dreams of a better future they end up with a life spent at home. A life of domestic chores, early marriage and having children.

Gabi the Goat was founded to help give these girls the education they deserve.

empowerement.title: Empowered Girls = Empowered Women
empowerement.image_caption: Empowered girls at the boarding school
empowerement.text_1_html:
We believe investing in girls‚Äô education is essential, as an educated girl educates her family and whole community.

So to help these girls we‚Äôve partnered with the UK-based non-profit Education For All (EFA) Morocco who build and run high-quality boarding houses for girls aged 12-18.
empowerement.text_2_html:
The boarding houses are built next to secondary schools and everything is provided for free for the girls:

  • Three nutritious meals a day
  • Hot showers
  • Cosy beds
  • Access to computers
  • Study support via an international volunteer program
  • Dedicated, local housemothers
  • Transport to and from home
empowerement.text_3_html:
The environment allows the girls thrive in their studies and since starting in 2007 there‚Äôs been an average of 90% pass rate across all years and 50 girls have even enrolled at university!

Some of these girls want to go on and become doctors, lawyers and scientists. We believe they deserve the chance to follow their dreams and we hope you do too.
empowerement.more_efa: Find out more about EFA Morocco

importance.title: The Importance of Education
importance.text_1_html:
Imagine if you‚Äôd stopped education at age 12‚Ä¶ how different would your life have been?

Well in Morocco it‚Äôs a reality... in some areas girls aren‚Äôt able to attend school after the age of 12. This is due to a lack of money or the long, unsafe journeys to schools that are too far away.
importance.text_2_html: So instead of these girls following their dreams of a better future they end up with a life spent at home. A life of domestic chores, early marriage and having children.
importance.text_3_html: I was born and raised in Morocco before moving to the US and it made me sad to hear this is happening today. I was privileged to have a great education so I knew I needed to do what I could to help these girls get the education they deserve.

crazy_idea.title: A Crazy Idea
crazy_idea.text_1_html:
I wanted to raise money to help these girls and at the same time do something fun to make more people aware of their situation.

I thought about my life as a child... in the Argan Oil forests of Morocco near to where I grew up live some strange goats who like to climb trees.
crazy_idea.text_2_html:
I loved goats and still do‚Ä¶ their long silly tongues, weird rectangular eyes and crazy screams are super funny.

So I set out to create a squawking rubber toy that represents this legendary animal. One that I could sell to raise money and help these girls get a better education...
crazy_idea.text_3_html: That‚Äôs when Gabi the Goat was born.

efa.title: Education For All
efa.image_caption: Gabi the Goat with the girl and Gabi the Goat's founder
efa.text_1_html:
I had a way to raise money with Gabi the Goat so now all I needed was a way to use the money to help the girls get the education they deserve.

This is where Education For All (EFA) Morocco comes in. EFA Morocco is a non-profit that builds and runs boarding houses for girls who want to continue their education.
efa.text_2_html:
The boarding houses allow the girls to live closer to school and everything is provided to them for free so money is no longer an issue.

With Gabi, I‚Äôm now on a mission:
To use the power of goats to provide girls in rural Morocco with a better education
efa.text_3_html:
Goat forth and spread the word!
- Simo Elalj, Founder
#GabiTheGoat #EducationForAll

social_product_description.title: Social Impact
social_product_description.text_html:
Well most girls in rural Morocco have to stop school at age 12 and miss out on much needed education.

We want this to change, so we partnered with Education For All Morocco who help these girls to get the education they deserve.

Each purchase of a merchandise on GabiTheGoat gives a girl in Morocco 3 days of education and housing.

product.donate_directly_html: You may also donate directly to Education For All.

social_section.title: Social Impact
social_section.text_html:
Thanks to your purchase we can help girls in rural Morocco to have a better education and follow their dreams.

We‚Äôve partnered with the non-profit Education For All Morocco to help build and run high-quality boarding houses near secondary schools. These boarding houses are provided free to girls aged 12-18 who wouldn‚Äôt usually be able to afford an education.

Each purchase you make empowers a girl in Morocco and provides her with 3 days of education and housing.
